programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: A man's (Tom Hardy) life unravels after he leaves a construction site at a critical time and drives to London to be present for the birth of a child conceived during a one-night stand.

programme.title: The Weekend
programme.desc: A down-on-her-luck comedian's vacation plans are interrupted by her ex-boyfriend and his new girlfriend.

programme.title: The Last Word
programme.desc: A once-successful businesswoman (Shirley MacLaine) develops a strong bond with the young local writer (Amanda Seyfried) who's penning her life story.

programme.title: Ronin
programme.desc: An Irish ringleader (Natascha McElhone) organizes an international team of hired guns (Robert De Niro, Jean Reno) to retrieve a briefcase from criminals.

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: A pregnant police chief (Frances McDormand) probes the murderous events that evolved from a desperate car salesman's (William H. Macy) kidnapping scheme.

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked assailants terrorize a young couple (Liv Tyler, Scott Speedman) in a romantic getaway to a remote cottage.

programme.title: The Strangers: Prey at Night
programme.desc: A road trip to visit relatives takes a dangerous turn when a family arrives at a secluded mobile home park that's mysteriously deserted -- until three masked psychopaths show up to satisfy their thirst for blood.

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: When the experiments of radical scientist Victor Frankenstein (James McAvoy) go too far, only Igor Strausman (Daniel Radcliffe), his equally brilliant protégé, can bring him back from the brink of madness and save him from his monstrous creation.

programme.title: Scary Movie
programme.desc: Keenen Ivory Wayans directed this sendup of slasher films in which a vengeful killer stalks a group of nubile teens.

programme.title: Scary Movie 2
programme.desc: Psychology students and their professor spend the weekend in a haunted house in this sendup of horror films.

programme.title: Scary Movie 3
programme.desc: After Cindy (Anna Faris) accidentally watches a strange videotape that causes the viewer to die within a week, she discovers the tape is only one of many weird happenings.

programme.title: Friday the 13th
programme.desc: The reopening of Camp Crystal Lake spells murder and mayhem for a group of sexually promiscuous counselors.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Four divers (Paul Walker, Jessica Alba, Scott Caan) cross paths with drug smugglers whose cargo plane has crashed near the site of underwater treasure.

programme.title: Into the Blue 2: The Reef
programme.desc: Two professional divers (Chris Carmack, Laura Vandervoort) fight for their lives when they encounter criminals in Hawaiian waters.

programme.title: The Forbidden Kingdom
programme.desc: A teenage fan (Michael Angarano) of Hong Kong cinema finds a Chinese relic and travels back in time to help legendary martial-artists free the Monkey King.

programme.title: Little Woods
programme.desc: In North Dakota, two estranged sisters are driven to extremes when their mother dies, leaving them with one week to pay back her mortgage.

programme.title: Little Woods
programme.desc: In North Dakota, two estranged sisters are driven to extremes when their mother dies, leaving them with one week to pay back her mortgage.

programme.title: McQueen
programme.desc: Archival footage and interviews with friends and family offer insight into the extraordinary life and career of British fashion designer Alexander McQueen.

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: President Skroob (Mel Brooks) pits evil Dark Helmet (Rick Moranis) against Lone Starr and the half-man, half-dog Barf (John Candy).

programme.title: The Pink Panther
programme.desc: Clumsy Inspector Jacques Clouseau (Peter Sellers) chases a jewel thief (David Niven) and his nephew (Robert Wagner).

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark
programme.desc: Clumsy Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) visits a nudist camp to prove a French maid (Elke Sommer) innocent of murder.

programme.title: The Return of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Bungling Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) once again seeks the Pink Panther diamond and maddens his boss (Herbert Lom).

programme.title: The Pink Panther Strikes Again
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) is on the trail of his ex-boss (Herbert Lom), who is out to destroy the world.

programme.title: My Boss's Daughter
programme.desc: To impress a young woman (Tara Reid), a man (Ashton Kutcher) agrees to housesit at his employer's mansion for one night.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: After meeting the gal (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) of his dreams, a charming slacker (Michael Cera) must contend with an army of her ex-boyfriends, wanting to get rid of him.

programme.title: Hot Summer Nights
programme.desc: An awkward teenager gets in over his head dealing drugs while falling for his business partner's enigmatic sister during one scorching summer in Cape Cod, Mass.

programme.title: Get Shorty
programme.desc: A film-loving loan shark (John Travolta) teams with a B-movie producer (Gene Hackman) to become a Hollywood mogul.

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Chili Palmer (John Travolta) runs afoul of music-industry players when he teams up with a friend's widow (Uma Thurman) to produce a singer's debut album.

programme.title: Revenge of the Green Dragons
programme.desc: A Chinese emigrant (Justin Chon) and his best friend (Kevin Wu) rise through the ranks of one of New York's most-powerful street gangs.

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: A billionaire (Pierce Brosnan) looking for new challenges attracts the attention of an investigator (Rene Russo) when a priceless Monet is stolen.

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: A billionaire (Pierce Brosnan) looking for new challenges attracts the attention of an investigator (Rene Russo) when a priceless Monet is stolen.

programme.title: Conviction
programme.desc: Following the imprisonment of her brother (Sam Rockwell), a woman (Hilary Swank) earns a law degree and fights to clear him of murder.

programme.title: Flashdance
programme.desc: A Pittsburgh welder (Jennifer Beals) dances nights in a bar, dates her boss (Michael Nouri) and dreams of going to ballet school.

programme.title: Lucky
programme.desc: A 90-year-old atheist has outlived and out-smoked his contemporaries, and as he comes to terms with his own mortality, he searches for ever-elusive enlightenment.

programme.title: Source Code
programme.desc: A helicopter pilot (Jake Gyllenhaal) takes part in a secret government program that enables him to assume someone's identity and experience the last few minutes of that person's life.

programme.title: Gemini
programme.desc: A heinous crime tests the complex relationship between a Hollywood starlet and her tenacious personal assistant. As the assistant unravels the mystery, she must confront her own understanding of friendship, truth and celebrity.

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: A man's (Tom Hardy) life unravels after he leaves a construction site at a critical time and drives to London to be present for the birth of a child conceived during a one-night stand.

programme.title: Mississippi Grind
programme.desc: Convinced that his newfound friend (Ryan Reynolds) is a good-luck charm, a gambling addict (Ben Mendelsohn) takes the man on a road trip to a high-stakes poker game in New Orleans.

programme.title: Out of Time
programme.desc: Considered a suspect in a deadly arson, a police chief (Denzel Washington) must cover his tracks while trying to prove his innocence.

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) continues his international quest to uncover his true identity while staying one step ahead of those who want to kill him.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: Animators Max and Dave Fleischer's adaptation of Jonathan Swift's classic about a shipwrecked Englishman in Lilliput.

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: Explorer John Smith (Colin Farrell) lands in 17th-century North America.

programme.title: The Witch
programme.desc: In 1630 New England, members of a farming family suspect the oldest daughter of witchcraft when the youngest son suddenly vanishes.

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: A woman (Charlize Theron) confronts traumatic, childhood memories of the murder of her mother and two sisters when she investigates the possibility that her brother (Corey Stoll) is innocent of the crime.

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Fred (Michael Caine), a retired composer and conductor, vacations at a Swiss Spa with his longtime friend Mick (Harvey Keitel). As Mick crafts what may be his final screenplay, Fred is given the opportunity to perform for the Queen.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew start on a 1966 Corvette, but his client doesn't want the color to be anywhere close to its original green.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The client is on board with the chosen shade of green, and the car moves into the paint booth.

programme.title: Sam's Garage
programme.desc: Sam and Doug test drive the Shelby before it goes home.

programme.title: My Classic Car
programme.desc: Dennis travels to Louisville, Ky., for the Beatersville Car Show, then he'll make his way to Glendora, Calif., and check out a radical '53 Stude and custom '39 Ford.

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Andy believes that the creation of lightweight ATVs for search and rescue teams could be a profitable business venture, but Bobby does not have much faith in his son's idea.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: The owner, Sanders, has had some bad luck with this '56 Belair going from shop to shop, and he still doesn't have his family dream car ready. Shorty's shop is the last stop. Joel and Shorty make sure this car is ready for the road.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and the team fix another shop's mistakes when a 2017 F-350 is hauled into the shop broken due to a botched lift; a client insists on the ultimate tailgating BBQ trailer with custom everything.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian finds a way to install a new suspension and massive tires under a Smart car to turn it into a desert pre-runner.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong join Dulcich to bring new life to the car with a shifter upgrade, new clutch and a near-full rear quarter panel replacement.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: Bruno has a newer F-150 he will be setting up for day trips, while Matt focuses on an older F-150 that will be built for overnight stays in nature.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Willie and Kevin undertake a mission to take a Dodge Ram and make it run better, sound louder and look cooler than ever; they fix an engine tick by replacing the manifold, install a new exhaust, and give the front end a brand-new look.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Arthur wants FantomWorks to make his 1967 Cyclone with 400,000 miles on it better than new; Antonio and his cousin, Andres, challenge Dan to build the fastest Mustang CS in Mexico.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: The crew finishes the build of the ultimate Mustang Sleeper for Antonio and Andres - a California Special powered by a Coyote Aluminator; Phil wants a '49 Chevy pick-up like the one he rode in as a child, but the truck is a disassembled puzzle.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Sean asks Dan to find a 1969 Camaro that can be built into the custom resto-mod of his dreams; Jeff wants to give his 1969 Cutlass a rare Hurst makeover, but the engine has never run and there are more parts in boxes than on the car.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Tom asks Dan to find him a rare '67 Camaro convertible with factory AC; Dave wants Dan to build a safe and almost-all-stock '71 Datsun, but the car is badly damaged from previous restoration work.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: David and Chuck want their enormous heirloom 1961 International Harvester Metro Van converted into a state-of-the-art restomod, with all the trimmings; David asks Dan to find and restore a 1966 Lincoln Convertible.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: The epic four-year-long wrestling match with the 1961 International Harvester Metro concludes with a one-of-a-kind van; Ray wants his '69 ZL1 to match the number 68 rally car, but he needs Dan's rare Winters stamped 427 COPO motor.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: In the first episode of the series, Derek extracts a 1967 Ford Mustang that has sat dormant for 28 years. But the years of rust and neglect won't stop him from transforming this car into a new creation.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Amid the cornfields of Michigan, Derek discovers a '37 Chevy Deluxe he wants to drive to GM headquarters in Detroit; but it's been off the road for over 20 years and is going to put up a fight to make the 150-mile journey.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek and Sean Bieri head back to Zweifel Motors in the Black Hills of South Dakota to revive an Oldsmobile station wagon Derek has been eyeing for 16 years.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek saves a 1966 Pontiac Tempest with a rare overhead-camshaft six-cylinder engine; just dusting off cobwebs won't do this car justice; Dan the Interior Man works his magic on the upholstery; Derek sets to work.

programme.title: Texas Metal

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team goes bigger on the yearlong 1950 Ford F5 COE build when the client asks for a last-minute Cummins diesel engine swap; a twisted graphic wraps up a months-long 2001 Ford F350.

programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich hit the road in a '66 Chevy Chevelle purchased sight unseen in an attempt to score two new project cars. The guys fix and tune their way from Washington to Arizona to rescue a dirt-cheap junkyard '75 Dodge Dart.

programme.title: Motorhead Garage
programme.desc: John Gardner explains oil viscosity and why it matters; Dave Dobson's guests bring in recovery gear to bring the driver and vehicle back home from the trail.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: David is a Volkswagen fanatic who wants a 1967 Beetle that can outmatch muscle cars; Robert wants a widened 1967 Corvette supercar, but first FantomWorks have to undo the bad repairs from at least three fiberglass rending accidents.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: An El Camino gets an upgrade under the hood with a new ultra port fuel injection setup.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: Everything is getting more expensive, and the truck market has been hit hard; discussing how to protect an investment, plus some quick-and-easy upgrades; Bruno takes in the 2023 SEMA Show.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill knows all too well that families are the lifeblood of the custom truck scene; a customer wants to transform a 1965 Ford Falcon Club Wagon into a fully custom family cruiser; a 1966 Cobra replica gets reinforced.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian loves the old International Scout body, but doesn't like the chassis underneath; he finds the right donor Scout body and fits it on a Jeep JK frame, with some modifications.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: For years Mike has wanted to build a 200-mph Cadillac, and now David has finally agreed to make it happen; they purchase a 1961 bubbbletop Cadillac deVille in Northern California; a Cadillac 500 engine wrapped inside a '73 AMC Gremlin.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek heads to a scrapyard to find a retired tow truck he can use around the shop; this 1979 Dodge D300 proves reluctant to go anywhere; Derek will have to hotwire the entire electrical system if he has any hope of making it home.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Ian kicks off a big build with some crazy fabrication that gets the Full Custom treatment; with a healthy dose of flavor and some unique ideas, Ian gets in deep with a new concept on an old classic.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Ian serves up a wild roadster build with his most ambitious client Victor; inspired by Ed Roth's unusual creations from the past, Ian lets loose on a pile of parts and works his magic to bring it all together.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Ian enlists the help of his good buddy Eric, and they get down with some real envisioning; taking the surf vibes to another level, the duo gets weird with a wild wagon.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Ian jumps off-road and gets into a desert-inspired hot rod build; he takes the unique mashup all the way, pulling together the perfect combination to take on the desert terrain.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Ian has his hands full as he attempts to rescue a classic survivor and wrap up some unfinished business on a friend's project; along the way, he picks up some fresh inspiration from a huge truck show and digs deep into a desert donor.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich give gold-medal examples of doing the wrong thing the right way with a big-block, four-speed '73 El Camino in need of an engine refresh; fixing a 454 that's obviously been messed with by means of a cheap at-home rebuild.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The problematic pig of a '73 El Camino named El Cochino is back; Freiburger and Dulcich address the camshaft and lifter issues that remain on their factory SS 454 four-speed Chevy, while also attempting to repair a terrible wheel-hop issue.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich rescue a flat-fender 1952 Jeep with a small-block Chevy.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Dulcich enlists Wiley Stevens to help make the derelict 1974 Bro-Charger into a roadworthy vehicle; after a lot of wrenching, they take a road-trip test drive to Las Vegas, Nevada, to meet up with Chris Birdsong and compete in an autocross event.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich take the racecar out of the '70 Plymouth Duster, known as the Crop Duster, by making it slower and quieter for more drivability off the track.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys add V-8 power to their 1971 Plymouth Duster, whose seized slant-six had seen better days; with some other repairs, the guys get the Duster back on the road and rescue another vehicle from themselves.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage

programme.title: FantomWorks

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: A teen (Olivia DeJonge) and her younger brother (Ed Oxenbould) discover a shocking secret about their seemingly charming grandparents while staying at their remote Pennsylvania farm.

programme.title: Mississippi Grind
programme.desc: Convinced that his newfound friend (Ryan Reynolds) is a good-luck charm, a gambling addict (Ben Mendelsohn) takes the man on a road trip to a high-stakes poker game in New Orleans.

programme.title: Hot Summer Nights
programme.desc: An awkward teenager gets in over his head dealing drugs while falling for his business partner's enigmatic sister during one scorching summer in Cape Cod, Mass.

programme.title: The Losers
programme.desc: A mysterious operative (Zoe Saldana) joins forces with a group of elite commandos (Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Chris Evans), as they hunt the man who organized a lethal betrayal against them.

programme.title: A Serious Man
programme.desc: An adulterous wife and a burdensome brother are among the problems that send a 1960s college professor (Michael Stuhlbarg) to seek help from three different rabbis.

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
programme.desc: Complications arise after two bachelors (Rupert Everett, Colin Firth) make use of the same pseudonym in 19th-century England.

programme.title: Master of the Drunken Fist: Beggar So
programme.desc: Due to a conspiracy, wealthy So Chan loses everything. Saved by the Beggars' Sect, he learns the long-lost martial art of Drunken Fist to defeat the person who framed him.

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: Agent 007 (George Lazenby) proposes to a contessa (Diana Rigg) and foils SPECTRE chief Blofeld's (Telly Savalas) agricultural plot.

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: A woman (Charlize Theron) confronts traumatic, childhood memories of the murder of her mother and two sisters when she investigates the possibility that her brother (Corey Stoll) is innocent of the crime.

programme.title: Conviction
programme.desc: Following the imprisonment of her brother (Sam Rockwell), a woman (Hilary Swank) earns a law degree and fights to clear him of murder.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Freed
programme.desc: Believing they've left behind the shadowy figures from the past, Christian Grey and his new wife, Anastasia, fully embrace their inextricable connection -- until sinister events start to jeopardize their happy ending before it even begins.

programme.title: Friday the 13th, Part VI: Jason Lives
programme.desc: Teenage Tommy (Thom Mathews) meets masked-killer Jason, brought back by a lightning bolt at the lake.

programme.title: Wild Rose
programme.desc: Fresh out of prison, a Scottish woman juggles her job and two children while pursuing her dream of becoming a country music star. She soon gets her chance when she travels to Nashville, Tenn., on a life-changing journey to discover her true voice.

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Fred (Michael Caine), a retired composer and conductor, vacations at a Swiss Spa with his longtime friend Mick (Harvey Keitel). As Mick crafts what may be his final screenplay, Fred is given the opportunity to perform for the Queen.

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Fred (Michael Caine), a retired composer and conductor, vacations at a Swiss Spa with his longtime friend Mick (Harvey Keitel). As Mick crafts what may be his final screenplay, Fred is given the opportunity to perform for the Queen.

programme.title: The Frozen Ground
programme.desc: A teenage escapee (Vanessa Hudgens) provides a critical break in the case, as an Alaskan detective (Nicolas Cage) hunts a serial killer who has been preying on women for 13 years.

programme.title: Zero Days
programme.desc: The malware worm Stuxnet, famously used against Iranian centrifuges, has been claimed by many to have originated as a joint effort between America and Israel.

programme.title: Lean on Pete

programme.title: Shiva Baby
programme.desc: While at a Jewish funeral service with her parents, a college student has an awkward encounter with her sugar daddy and her ex-girlfriend.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Four divers (Paul Walker, Jessica Alba, Scott Caan) cross paths with drug smugglers whose cargo plane has crashed near the site of underwater treasure.

programme.title: The Last Movie Star

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: A woman takes her son to the local hardware store to get a present in celebration of his 11th birthday in 1946.

programme.title: Skin Can Breathe
programme.desc: A gay teen tries to adjust to a new life after moving from Cambodia to America with his mother.

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: Explorer John Smith (Colin Farrell) lands in 17th-century North America.

programme.title: Whiteout
programme.desc: The only U.S. Marshal (Kate Beckinsale) assigned to Antarctica has just three days to solve the continent's first murder before six months of darkness strand her with the killer.

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: A young programmer (Domhnall Gleeson) at an Internet company is chosen to evaluate the capabilities and consciousness of a beautiful and sophisticated robot (Alicia Vikander).

programme.title: Mojave

programme.title: Fargo

programme.desc: A hardened loner (Richard Gere) shapes up for a military drill instructor (Louis Gossett Jr.) and a factory girl (Debra Winger) from town.
